Hung-Chi Hi, I’m Hung-Chi! Originally from Taiwan, I’ve recently relocated to Toronto and am eager to start my professional journey here in Canada. With over three years of experience as a back-end developer specializing in Java, I’ve developed extensive expertise in building and optimizing APIs, managing databases, and integrating third-party services.
I’m currently seeking opportunities to contribute my skills, collaborate with passionate teams, and continue growing as a developer. If you’re looking for a dedicated and experienced Java engineer, I’d love to connect!
Feel free to reach out—let’s chat about how I can add value to your team.

Affirm How It Started I was directly contacted by a recruiter from Affirm via LinkedIn, who invited me to submit my resume. It felt like a great opportunity, so I jumped at the chance!
My Interview Process According to what I found online, Affirm’s interview process typically consists of four stages. I’m currently in the first stage, and I’ll break it down below:
Affirm Interview Stages Initial Screening (Current Stage)
This is where I am right now! It started with the recruiter reaching out on LinkedIn. After I submitted my resume, we scheduled a call to discuss my background, skills, and interest in Affirm. It’s mostly about getting to know each other and seeing if there’s a good fit. Technical Assessment
From what I’ve read, this stage usually involves a coding challenge or technical exercise to evaluate my problem-solving and programming skills. I’m preparing for this next step! Technical Interviews
This stage seems to involve deeper technical discussions, likely with engineers from the team. I expect it’ll include coding problems, system design questions, or a dive into my past projects. Final Round (Behavioral + Team Fit)
The last stage appears to focus on cultural fit and behavioral questions. I might meet with senior team members or managers to talk about my experience, values, and how I’d contribute to Affirm. A Few Thoughts I’ll keep updating this as I progress through the stages. If anyone has tips for interviewing with Affirm, I’d love to hear them!
